entries.title: Former US police officer gets nearly 12 years for fatal shooting
entries.description: Ex-officer was convicted of manslaughter for fatally shooting 28-year-old Black woman Atatiana Jefferson in Texas home.

entries.title: Taliban release two detained Americans in ‘goodwill gesture’
entries.description: The release was revealed on the same day the Taliban banned women from attending universities in Afghanistan.

entries.title: January 6: What the criminal referrals against Donald Trump mean
entries.description: Department of Justice will have the final say on whether to indict Trump on serious charges recommended by committee.

entries.title: Photos: Zelenskyy visits troops as Putin hails Russian resolve
entries.description: Both leaders sought to build morale as the stalemated conflict grinds through its 10th month and winter sets in.

entries.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried paves way for extradition
entries.description: Bankman-Fried has signed legal papers paving the way for his extradition to the US from the Bahamas.

entries.title: What effect will further Western arms in Ukraine have?
entries.description: As Ukraine appeals for more weapons, critics worry further militarisation will just mean more war.

entries.title: Morocco’s Atlas Lions receive hero’s welcome on return home
entries.description: The national team made history in this year’s FIFA World Cup after beating elite teams Belgium, Portugal and Spain.

entries.title: Taliban says women banned from universities in Afghanistan
entries.description: The US and Britain criticised the ban, which the Taliban says preserves “national interest” and women’s “honour”

entries.title: US reproductive health group offers telemedicine abortion service
entries.description: Planned Parenthood in US state of Kansas offers video consultations following statewide vote affirming abortion rights.

entries.title: The Atlas Lions kindled a sense of belonging in Europe
entries.description: The success of the Moroccan team is a tale of identity redemption for Moroccan diaspora communities.

entries.title: Twitter is hit by dozens of legal complaints by ex-employees
entries.description: Lawyer filed 100 demands for arbitration demands against Twitter accusing it of sex discrimination, illegal termination.

entries.title: As climate clock ticks, aviator races to photograph glaciers
entries.description: Earth's glaciers are melting at an alarming rate, and aviator Garrett Fisher is on a mission to photograph them all.

entries.title: Canada brings sanctions against former Haitian justice ministers
entries.description: Canada has accused Berto Dorce and Liszt Quitel of money laundering on behalf of powerful criminal organisations.

entries.title: Wells Fargo hit with record $3.7bn fine over mismanagement
entries.description: The consumer watchdog ordered the bank to redress more than 16 million accounts affected by widespread violations.

entries.title: Argentinians ecstatic as World Cup winners return for parade
entries.description: Lionel Messi posts photo of him sleeping with World Cup trophy before celebration that draws hundreds of thousands.

entries.title: Peru’s Congress to consider moving elections forward again
entries.description: Holding early elections is major demand of protesters who have taken to the streets since removal of President Castillo.

entries.title: Tunisia judge orders arrest of former prime minister
entries.description: Ali Larayedh, vice president of opposition Ennahdha party, is arrested days after Tunisia's legislative elections.

entries.title: Photos: Uncertainty among asylum seekers at border over US rules
entries.description: The US Supreme Court issues temporary order to keep Title 42 pandemic-era limits on asylum seekers in place,

entries.title: Pakistani raid kills all Taliban hostage-takers, officials say
entries.description: Thirty-three TTP fighters were killed when special forces raided the facility where they were holding hostages.

entries.title: Iran and EU signal continued work on nuclear deal in Jordan
entries.description: Communication lines will be kept open despite worsening ties, but there has been no sign of progress toward a deal.

entries.title: Why Qatar 2022 was also Africa’s World Cup
entries.description: Tournament was an indication of continent's growth, with Morocco's run crowning impressive displays by African teams.

entries.title: California earthquake leaves tens of thousands without power
entries.description: Downed power lines, gas leaks and damaged roads were reported after the 6.4 magnitude quake off northern California.

entries.title: Kenya Ice Lions: Ice hockey challenges in East Africa
entries.description: Kenya’s only ice hockey team must overcome many obstacles to get back on the ice and back into competition after COVID.

entries.title: Thai rescuers find five bodies, one survivor after warship sinks
entries.description: Officials say 76 people have been rescued, five have been found dead and 24 are still missing.

entries.title: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy visits front-line city of Bakhmut
entries.description: President meets troops facing down Russia's offensive as Putin warns of difficulties in partly-occupied regions.

entries.title: Giant Little Choppers: Mozambique’s helicopter kid
entries.description: A Mozambican boy who builds life-size models of helicopters and cars from wire and cardboard has high ambitions.

entries.title: Pakistan launches operation to free officers held hostage by TTP
entries.description: Security forces storm counterterrorism centre in Bannu to free several security officials taken hostage two days ago.

entries.title: German court convicts 97-year-old ex-Nazi camp typist
entries.description: Irmgard Furchner has been found guilty of complicity in mass killings at WWII concentration camp.

entries.title: Crematoriums in China struggle as COVID spreads
entries.description: Cities across China also scrambling to install hospital beds and build fever clinics amid a widening COVID-19 outbreak.

entries.title: UK nurses stage second strike for inflation-busting pay
entries.description: Up to 100,000 members of the Royal College of Nursing demand better pay to make up for years of real-terms salary cuts.

entries.title: Palestinian prisoner diagnosed with cancer dies in Israel custody
entries.description: Palestinian officials and rights groups had long called for Abu Hmaid's release after he was diagnosed with cancer.

entries.title: Ghana suspends payment of most external debts
entries.description: Finance ministry says Accra will not service debts including its Eurobonds, commercial loans and most bilateral loans.

entries.title: How Lionel Messi’s ‘bisht’ exposed Western media’s racism again
entries.description: The Arab cloak was a sign of respect for Messi for his World Cup win. But ignorant newsrooms will not understand that.

entries.title: Which European nations are handling the energy crisis best?
entries.description: France, Spain, Germany, Italy and Greece are doing some things right, but face challenging times ahead, say experts.

entries.title: Niger Delta decries slow cleanups, decades after oil spills
entries.description: Residents say response slow, rehabilitation of Nigerian oil-rich state's environment must speed up.

entries.title: Call to save Rohingya refugees adrift on boat without water, food
entries.description: Governments asked to launch search and rescue mission amid reports of refugee deaths on vessel drifting for weeks.

entries.title: Ethiopia’s biggest bank ‘resumes services’ in Tigray
entries.description: Commercial Bank says it has reopened its branches in Shire, Alamata and Korem after more than year of shutdown.

entries.title: Huge crowds welcome Argentina team home after World Cup victory
entries.description: Thousands line up in the middle of the night to get a glimpse of the team that won one of the greatest World Cup finals.

entries.title: China, Russia hold joint naval exercises to ‘deepen’ partnership
entries.description: China and Russia have increased military exercises in an alignment of foreign policies and in opposition to the West.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 300
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 300th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: What lies ahead in Nigeria’s election?
entries.description: The Stream also looks at prospects for Sudan's political transition and Zimbabwe's presidential contest in 2023.

entries.title: World Bank slashes China’s growth outlook to 2.7 percent in 2022
entries.description: US-based institution sees China's economy growing 4.3 percent next year, down from 8.1 percent.

entries.title: Harvey Weinstein found guilty of rape by Los Angeles court
entries.description: Jailed ex-Hollywood kingpin faces a new 24-year sentence for raping an Italian woman in Los Angeles in 2013.

entries.title: UN chief warns of far-right, white supremacy threats in West
entries.description: Antonio Guterres said greatest terrorism threat in West 'comes from the extreme right, neo-Nazis and white supremacy'.

entries.title: FTX founder Bankman-Fried agrees to extradition to US: lawyer
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried faces criminal charges in the US related to the collapse of his cryptocurrency exchange FTX.

entries.title: North Korea slams Japan’s military buildup, promises ‘action’
entries.description: North Korea's foreign ministry calls Japan's new $320bn security strategy 'wrong and dangerous', promises a response.

entries.title: China’s smartphone giant Xiaomi slashes workforce: reports
entries.description: Chinese smartphone maker says it has implemented routine "personnel optimisation and organisational streamlining".

entries.title: Australia FM to push for release of citizens during China visit
entries.description: Australian journalist Cheng Lei was detained in August 2020 and Chinese-born Australian writer Yang Jun in January 2019.

entries.title: Democratic stronghold mulls joining Republican push to ban TikTok
entries.description: Washington state is considering banning the Chinese-owned app for government business amid national security concerns.

entries.title: Putin tells security services to find ‘traitors and spies’: Media
entries.description: Russian President also ordered strengthening of Russia's borders and safety of residents in annexed regions of Ukraine.
